Uses of Interface
assignment.MenuItem

  • Uses of MenuItem in assignment

    Classes in assignment that implement MenuItem
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Desserts
    Represents a specific Desserts item in the Desserts menu
    class 
    Drinks
    Represents a specific drink item in the drink menu
    class 
    GenericMenuItem
    Serves as the parent class of all the menu items
    class 
    MainCourse
    Represents a specific MainCourse item in the MainCourse menu
    class 
    PromotionalSetPackage
    Represents a PromotionalSetPackage item in the promotional menu

    Method
    Description
    MenuItem
    GenericMenu.getItem​(int i, ArrayList<? extends MenuItem> MenuList)
    Generic function that all specialized menu class relies to return the Menu item object based on the index provided by the user
    MenuItem
    Menu.getItem​(int indexOfItem)
    Return the MenuItem chosen by user based on the index position in the menu for further processing

    Methods in assignment with parameters of type MenuItem
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    SalesRevenueReport.addIndividualSalesToReport​(MenuItem m)
    Adds a new individual sales Item into the report whenever a menu item is created
    void
    GenericMenu.create​(MenuItem item)
    Takes in a menu item created based on the default constructor (which consists of null values) and prompts the user for their input to update each of these fields
    IndividualSales
    SalesRevenueReport.getValue​(MenuItem m)
    Returns the individual sales for a particular menu item
    void
    GenericMenu.update​(int option, MenuItem tempItem, SalesRevenueReport rpt)
    The generic update function used by all specialized menu to update their common fields (Name, Description and price)
    void
    SalesRevenueReport.updateName​(MenuItem m, String newName)
    Updates the name of the menu item in the sales report.
